pr_title: [#10650] Add null check for getFeedbackSession in API actions

timeline.bodyText: This violates our policy on DB layer though https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/blob/master/docs/design.md#policies-2
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
There are two very dangerous things done here:

Assuming that feedback session not found is not desirable. DB layer has no concern with such.
Throwing unchecked exception in DB layer.
replies.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: The problem was that this issues is quite prevalent. There is almost never a null check for logic.getFeedbackSession() in the access control of feedback session actions. I've moved the check to checkSpecificAccessControl
replies.author: madanalogy

timeline.message: Add null checks for feedback session access control

timeline.bodyText:
This entire PR screams "DRY". You should abstract this entire method (get feedback session, throw EntityNotFoundException if not found) into the parent Action class.
While you're at it, see if you can also employ the same method for course, instructor, and/or student objects.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: That's going to take a while. What if I just move the validation to the logic layer? i.e. throw exception if not found at logic.getFeedbackSession()
replies.author: madanalogy

replies.bodyText:
Logic has no business with throwing that kind of exception
Even if it does, logic layer must not throw any runtime exception
replies.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: Just getFeedbackSession doesn't immediately tell that it's going to throw some exception if the value is null. Name it something like getNonNullFeedbackSession?
